Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.statistics

Class Statistic

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.statistics.Statistic
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
StatisticMedian
public class Statistic extends Object implements Serializable
Private container class to store residual statistics. Values include the count, minimum, maximum, mean, and standard deviation, rms, and relative standard deviation.
Author:
jrhipp
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Statistic

      public Statistic()
      Default constructor.

    • Statistic

      public Statistic(int count, double min, double max, double sum, double sumsqr, double meanDev)
      Defines a new Statistic from existing data.
      Parameters:
      count - The number of entries.
      min - The minimum value input.
      max - The maximum value input.
      sum - The sum of all input values.
      sumsqr - The sum of squares of all input values.
      meanDev - The mean deviation.

  • Method Details

    • set

      public void set(Statistic s)
      Sets this Statistic with the values of the input Statistic.
      Parameters:
      s - The input Statistic object that will be set into this one.

    • set

      public void set(DoubleGet dg)
      Sets the statistics to the array defined by the input DoubleGet.
      Parameters:
      dg - a DoubleGet array

    • add

      public void add(DoubleGet dg)
      Adds the array defined by the input DoubleGet to this statistics object. The mean deviation is calculated if aCount == 0 on input.
      Parameters:
      dg - a DoubleGet array

    • add

      public void add(double value)
      Increments the count, updates the minimum and maximum values against the input value, and adds the input value to the mean sum and the square of the input value to the standard deviation sum. Update only occurs if the statistic has not been finalized. Calling getMean() or getStdDev() will finalize the statistic until reset() is called.
      Parameters:
      value - The value with which the statistics are updated.

    • remove

      public void remove(double value)
      Special case function to use when known values that were previously added are to be removed. Note that this function cannot identify minimum or maximum anymore. Those values can only be set by function add().
      Parameters:
      value - The value to be removed from the statistic.

    • add

      public void add(Statistic s)
      Sums the result of the input Statistic, s, into this Statistic.
      Parameters:
      s - The input Statistic to be added to this Statistic.

    • scale

      public void scale(double scl)
      Scales the current statistics by scl. The minimum, maximum, and sum are multiplied by the input scale. The sum squared is multiplied by the square of the input scale.
      Parameters:
      scl - The value by which the statistics are scaled.

    • getCount

      public int getCount()
      Returns the input count.
      Returns:
      The input count.

    • getSum

      public double getSum()
      Return total sum.
      Returns:
      Total sum.

    • getSumSqr

      public double getSumSqr()
      Return total sum of squares.
      Returns:
      Total sum of squares.

    • getMinimum

      public double getMinimum()
      Returns the input minimum thus far from all entries using the method add(double value).
      Returns:
      The input minimum.

    • getMaximum

      public double getMaximum()
      Returns the input maximum thus far from all entries using the method add(double value).
      Returns:
      The input maximum.

    • getAbsMaximum

      public double getAbsMaximum()
      Returns the largest absolute value of the minimum and maximum.
      Returns:
      The largest absolute value of the minimum and maximum.

    • getAbsMaxFromMean

      public double getAbsMaxFromMean()
      Returns the largest absolute value from the mean.
      Returns:
      The largest absolute value from the mean.

    • getMean

      public double getMean()
      Returns the mean. If the object has not yet been updated the mean will be evaluated before returning the result.
      Returns:
      The mean.

    • getStdDev

      public double getStdDev()
      Returns the standard deviation. If the object has not yet been updated the standard deviation will be evaluated before returning the result.
      Returns:
      The standard deviation

    • getMeanDeviation

      public double getMeanDeviation()

    • getRelativeMeanDeviation

      public double getRelativeMeanDeviation()

    • getRelativeStdDev

      public double getRelativeStdDev()
      Returns the relative standard deviation (sigma/mean). If the mean is zero then Double.MAX_VALUE is returned.
      Returns:
      The relative standard deviation (sigma/mean).

    • getVariance

      public double getVariance()
      Returns the variance. If the object has not yet been updated the standard deviation will be evaluated before returning the result.
      Returns:
      The standard deviation

    • getRelativeVariance

      public double getRelativeVariance()
      Returns the relative variance (sigma^2/rms).
      Returns:
      The relative standard variance (sigma^2/rms).

    • getRelativeMeanVariance

      public double getRelativeMeanVariance()

    • getRMS

      public double getRMS()
      Returns the rms. If the object has not yet been updated the rms result will be evaluated before returning the result.
      Returns:
      The RMS.

    • getDiffAbsMaximum

      public double getDiffAbsMaximum(Statistic s)
      Returns the difference between this absolute maximum and the absolute maximum of the input Statistic.
      Parameters:
      s - The input Statistic whose absolute maximum will be differenced with this Statistics absolute maximum.
      Returns:
      The difference between this absolute maximum and the absolute maximum of the input Statistic.

    • getDiffMean

      public double getDiffMean(Statistic s)
      Returns the difference between this mean and the mean of the input Statistic.
      Parameters:
      s - The input Statistic whose mean will be differenced with this Statistics mean.
      Returns:
      The difference between this mean and the mean of the input Statistic.

    • getDiffStdDev

      public double getDiffStdDev(Statistic s)
      Returns the difference between this standard deviation and the standard deviation of the input Statistic.
      Parameters:
      s - The input Statistic whose standard deviation will be differenced with this Statistics standard deviation.
      Returns:
      The difference between this standard deviation and the standard deviation of the input Statistic.

    • getDiffRMS

      public double getDiffRMS(Statistic s)
      Returns the difference between this rms and the rms of the input Statistic.
      Parameters:
      s - The input Statistic whose rms will be differenced with this Statistics rms.
      Returns:
      The difference between this rms and the rms of the input Statistic.

    • getResult

      public double getResult(Statistic.StatType st)

    • getSingleEntryResult

      public double getSingleEntryResult(double v, Statistic.StatType st)
